The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically growing on the trunks of trees or rocks in forested areas. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, and it reproduces through spores rather than seeds. Grammitis knutsfordiana is a rare and specialized plant, often found in specific microhabitats with high moisture levels.
